properties.headline: Low Water Advisory issued February 6 at 6:07AM CST until February 6 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
* WHAT...Abnormally low water levels expected.

* WHERE...Galveston Bay.

* WHEN...For the Low Water Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 9
PM CST this evening. Low Tide at Manchester is at 12:37pm today.
The Small Craft Advisory has expired.

* IMPACTS...Below normal water levels will result in hazardous
navigating conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Low Water Advisory, low tide this
afternoon will be much below normal, around -1.0 to -1.5 feet
below Mean Low Level Water (MLLW). At around one foot below
MLLW, areas of bare ground begin to appear in the upper reaches
of the ship channel. Once we get to around two feet below MLLW,
then bare ground begins to appear around Morgan's Point and
Manchester. The Small Craft Advisory has expired, but moderate
northwesterly flow is expected through this afternoon, so please
continue to use caution while out on the water if you are in a
small craft.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should navigate shallow waters with extreme caution due
to below normal water levels.

NWSheadline: LOW WATER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED
